result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:02 PM Defendant ELIZABETH J MATTESON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for ELIZABETH J MATTESON. Attorney Matt McElroy Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $7,500 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
